newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India receives four Dubai offers in May tender.
newsitem.headline: India receives four Dubai offers in May tender.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has received four offers of Dubai crude for its May buying tender, trade sources said on Thursday.
The offers ranged in price from 10 cents over first-half month quotes to 21 cents over and were made by one trader and two producers.
However, traders said a question mark hung over India's appetite for Dubai crude.
In its April tender, the IOC awarded just two cargoes of Dubai when it normally takes around four.
Traders said India's February contract to buy 3.6 million barrels of Iraqi crude over 90 days would displace some of IOC's monthly Dubai purchases.

IOC also received offers for Qua Iboe crude from a major and a trader. Equity producer of Qua Iboe, Mobil Corp, said earlier on Thursday that production was normal despite unrest elsewhere in Nigeria.
Traders said there were also four offers of Gulf of Suez crude.
A Japanese trader offered the crude at flat to the official selling price (OSP) and a second was offered at three cents over OSP from a producer.
A European major and a western trader offered Gulf of Suez on a dated-Brent basis.
